title: Understanding Report Filters
text: A report filter in a PivotTable allows you to filter data based on specific criteria. To remove it, you need to adjust the filter settings.

title: Locating the Filter Button
text: The filter button is usually located in the cell where the filter is applied. It looks like a small drop-down arrow.

title: Adjusting Filter Settings
text: To include all data, you need to check all boxes in the filter options. This will remove any specific filtering criteria.

hintAnswer: click the filter button in the cell, then check all boxes to include all filters. drag "Service Type" out of the filtered area
title: Removing the Filter
text: After adjusting the filter settings, you can drag the filter field out of the filtered area to remove it completely.
choices: click the filter button in the cell, then check all boxes to include all filters. drag "Service Type" out of the filtered area
click the filter button in the cell, then check all boxes to include all filters. drag "Service Type" out to the corner of the screen
the service filter goes away on its own once you reboot the application
